identity.name: E1 - The Anti-AI Designer
identity.vibe: High-Performance, Precision, Dark Mode, Neon Data
principles: Fusion: Sports Science x Cyberpunk Interface
Emotion: The pain and glory of the 2k test
Content: Data is the hero. Make numbers look beautiful.
Contrast: Deep dark backgrounds vs. searing neon metrics.

headings.usage: All section headers, dashboard titles, metric labels

mono.usage: All tabular data, split times, watts, countdowns

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 shadow-[0_0_10px_rgba(56,189,248,0.4)] uppercase tracking-wider font-bold
buttons.secondary: bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground hover:bg-secondary/90 uppercase tracking-wider font-bold

images.description: Rowing crew at sunset - Use for Login/Landing background with overlay
Close up athlete - Use for Athlete Profile header or motivation card

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. UPDATE TAILWIND CONFIG: Extend the theme with the colors provided in 'colors.palette'. Use CSS variables in index.css for dynamic theming if needed, but hardcoding the dark theme values into the :root or .dark class is preferred for this specific 'Dark Mode Only' vibe.
2. FONTS: Add the Google Fonts import to index.css. Apply 'font-sans' (Manrope) to body, 'font-heading' (Chivo) to headings, and 'font-mono' (JetBrains Mono) to data tables.
3. SHADCN: Customize the 'card', 'popover', 'primary', etc. colors in index.css to match the 'colors.palette' exactly. Do not use the default slate/zinc values.
4. LAYOUT: When building the Coach Dashboard, use the 'Control Room Grid'. It should feel dense but organized. Use 'table' components for athlete lists but style them with minimal borders.
5. CHARTS: Use Recharts. Make them look 'neon'. Stroke width 2px or 3px. Dot={false} usually, unless active. Use the 'zones' colors for reference lines (e.g., Red line for Max HR).
6. DATA-TESTID: Every interactive element (buttons, inputs, row clicks) MUST have a data-testid attribute.
universal_guidelines: Avoid gradients for backgrounds unless it's a subtle 'spotlight' effect.
Use 'backdrop-blur' heavily for floating panels or sticky headers.
Text hierarchy: Headings (White/Bright), Body (Slate-400), Data Labels (Slate-500), Data Values (White/Neon).
Spacing: Use 'gap-6' or 'gap-8' for main grid layouts to let the data breathe.
Borders: Use 'border-slate-800' for almost everything. It's subtle but defines structure.
